meanings.definition: The act of gaining access to something again.
meanings.sent1: After losing her keys, her reaccessions to the house took a while.
meanings.sent2: The reaccessions to the database were necessary after the system crash.
meanings.sent3: His reaccessions to the cookie jar were always met with a guilty smile.
meanings.sent4: The reaccessions to his childhood memories brought back a flood of emotions.
meanings.sent5: The reaccessions to the treasure chest revealed long-forgotten jewels.

meanings.definition: The process of regaining possession or control of something.
meanings.sent1: The reaccessions of his stolen bike made him feel relieved.
meanings.sent2: She fought for the reaccessions of her stolen identity.
meanings.sent3: The reaccessions of the lost toy from the dog's mouth was a victory.
meanings.sent4: His reaccessions of power in the company surprised many.
meanings.sent5: The reaccessions of the stolen painting were celebrated by the museum staff.

meanings.definition: The act of rejoining an organization or group.
meanings.sent1: His reaccessions to the club brought back fond memories.
meanings.sent2: The reaccessions to the team boosted morale.
meanings.sent3: Her reaccessions to the book club were met with cheers.
meanings.sent4: The reaccessions to the band made the music sound complete again.
meanings.sent5: The reaccessions to the committee added valuable expertise.
